title: BARC Scientific Officers Online Form 2026
age_limit: 2026 - Apply Online for Scientific Officers Posts The Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) invites applications for Scientific Officers posts. Apply online from 22 December to 21 January 2026. Eligibility: B.Sc, B.Tech/B.E, M.Sc, M.E/M.Tech. Official Website: barc.gov.in. Updated December 24, 2025 10:33 AM 24 December 2025 10:33 AM by Abisha Muthukumar Join us Add as a preferred source on Google Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) has released an official notification for the recruitment of Scientific Officers Posts. Interested and eligible candidates can apply Online through the official BARC website. The last date to submit the application form is 21-01-2026. In this article, you’ll find the BARC Scientific Officers Posts recruitment details, including eligibility criteria, age limit, salary structure, selection process, application steps, and direct links to the official notification and Online application form. The Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) is inviting applications for the Scientific Officer positions through the OCES/DGFS 2026 recruitment. This prestigious program offers engineering graduates and science postgraduates the chance to join the Department of Atomic Energy (DAE) through two distinct training schemes: the one-year Orientation Course for Engineering Graduates and Science Postgraduates (OCES-2026) and the two-year DAE Graduate Fellowship Scheme for Engineering Graduates (DGFS-2026). Successful candidates will undergo intensive training, with a stipend of ₹74,000 per month during the training period. Upon appointment, they will be placed in Group-A posts with an attractive pay scale under the 7th CPC, totaling approximately ₹1,35,000 per month, along with various allowances. This recruitment offers a unique opportunity to contribute to India's nuclear and atomic energy programs in various DAE units, such as BARC, IGCAR, and NPCIL. Candidates must meet specific educational qualifications, including a minimum of 60% marks in engineering or science degrees, and fulfill the age criteria (18 to 31
